While the Obama administration supported the expulsion of Russia from the G-8 because of the annexation of Crimea, it did not do so unilaterally, and in fact could not act unilaterally. "The Group of Seven was united by the decision to expel Russia from the Group of Eight, so it was a joint decision by consensus," said Aslund. In a statement dated 24 March 2014, the leaders of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Council of Europe and the European Commission jointly wrote that they "strongly condemn" Russia's actions in Crimea.
